title: 107_s2449
content: The Act titled "Federal Responsibility for Immigrant Health Act of 2002" allows federal payments under Medicaid for emergency medical conditions of certain aliens. The Social Security Act is amended to include necessary care and services for emergency medical conditions, pregnancy-related services, and communicable disease testing or treatment for certain aliens. Additionally, states have the option to eliminate residency requirements for these aliens under Medicaid. The Social Security Act is amended to include necessary care and services for emergency medical conditions, pregnancy-related services, and communicable disease testing or treatment for certain aliens. States have the option to eliminate residency requirements for these aliens under Medicaid. Amendments made by this section apply to medical assistance provided on or after the date of enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens is amended to provide $25,000,000 for fiscal years 1998 through 2001 and $50,000,000 for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. The determination of state allotments is also revised to include specific guidelines for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will calculate allotments for the 15 states with the highest percentage of undocumented aliens for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. The allotment for each state will be based on the ratio of undocumented aliens in the state compared to the total percentage for all states. The allotment to a State not paid out under subsection (c) is available for payment in the subsequent fiscal year. The percentage of undocumented aliens in a State is determined based on the most recent estimates. Funds must be used to assist hospitals and providers of emergency health services to undocumented aliens. Providers of Emergency Health Services to Undocumented Aliens will receive funds from the Secretary based on State plans to assist hospitals in areas impacted by health costs related to undocumented aliens. Providers of Emergency Health Services to Undocumented Aliens will receive funds based on State plans or alternative proxies for measuring emergency health services volume. Definitions and special rules apply, with "hospital" defined as in the Social Security Act. The term 'hospital' is defined as in the Social Security Act, and 'provider' includes physicians, health care professionals, and entities providing emergency ambulance services. Providers are considered related to a hospital if they furnish emergency health services to the same individual. Amounts paid under this subsection cannot substitute for Federal payments under title XIX of the Social Security Act. The amendments made by this section shall apply beginning with fiscal year 2003, and the amounts paid under this subsection cannot substitute for Federal payments under title XIX of the Social Security Act. Permitting states and localities to provide healthcare to all individuals. The amendment to Section 411 of the Act excludes health benefits provided to individuals from the definition of assistance. The amendment excludes health benefits provided by a State or local government from the definition of assistance. Effective immediately, the changes apply to healthcare provided before, on, or after the enactment of the Act.
